comment: Highly unprofessional, unpredictable, and disrespectful. Would issue harsh warnings and confusing instructions, whilst grading either more reasonably, or even further more unreasonably. Defensive towards opposition, and more eager to satiate her own ego than to nurture student interests & passions. Unfortunate given potential of subject material.

She is not particularly bad or unreasonable, she is just confusing. Her criteria are not clear in the slightest and her online courses are very jumbled. She is very short in conversation and is not great at clarification. She gives out her phone number and encourages students to text or reach out if need be. Very middle of the road professor.

She isn't the best but she isn't the worst. I wouldn't take her again because of the inconsistent grading policies and amount of work needed in the class. However, she understands when students go through rough times and is there to help. At the beginning of the semester, it was a lot to get used to, but now, I'm indifferent to what is expected
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Dr. Russell is an awesome professor. I took her Cultural Anthropology course online in the Fall of 2022 and learned a lot about myself and the world around me. Be ready for lots of weekly assignments and reading. While there is a lot, the sources provided are wonderful. She is helpful and was always willing to meet with people to talk!

3307(wasn't an option) this might actually be the worst class ive ever taken. sometimes she'd forget to post something & post it midweek & still expect it to be done just a few days later. there were 2-4 assignments each week with inconsistent grading and disrespect for her students. ask a question & youre met with a rude answer as if you're stupid
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: ANTH3305 (wasn't an option when posting). BEWARE!!! She is disorganized and unprofessional. Doesn't explain or teach anything. Posted modules late but expected all the work to be turned in by the OG due date. She changed the work criteria without informing us months into the semester. Grading criteria unclear, just have to luck out.

TAKE THIS CLASS! Lots of online tests, but she gives you plenty of time and tells you to look up answers. Lots of online homework but its easy. I made a high A on every test but one-- never studied. She goes on tangents during lectures and always takes attendance. The class is boring but take it. There is a group project at the end but its easy.
rating_tags: Participation matters--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Would take again

comment: Mrs. Russell's class was one of the easiest college courses I've ever taken! The textbook is all online and so are all the assignments and tests. The online assignments can be time-consuming but are really easy. The quizzes are not timed and you get unlimited answers. Easy A if you just do the work. Does take attendance.

Professor Russel is a tad weird. All her test are super easy & can be found on google. Her outlines can be very hard but are helpful. Anyone who says she is a tough grader has not actually attempted to talk to her, she reopened test and articles multiple times for me because i asked her. Really nice and the final is a group presentation so easy 100

She is very unclear on grading criteria, but then acts like it is so obvious what you should have done. If you share an opposing opinion she is very rude about it. She will laugh at students in class. If you don't participate in class discussions you'll probably like her. It's easy to tune her out and still pass the class. Boring and rude

She was never clear about what exactly she was looking for when she graded our assignments. We did article outlines once every couple weeks and she never once went over how she wanted us to do them so the majority of us ended up failing those assignments.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Professor Russell has got to be the toughest professor I've had yet. She does not give clear instructions, her grading is very specific and the outlines are impossible. She is extremely sarcastic and she only replies to one email a day. Not accessible outside the classroom. She doesn't seem to care about her students and she is very unorganized.

Professor Russell is a great professor but if you skip class and don't read you won't like her. She is really helpful and truly wants her students to understand the material. She posts literally everything to D2L so if you're sick/absent you know what is going on in class. It's impossible to get below an A due to the amount of extra credit given.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Avoid her if you can. Lectures are boring and heavily weighted with political undertones, in my opinion. There was a ridiculous amount of pointless and frustrating group work on random, irrelevant articles. Tests weren't hard, but they were heavily based on the group work articles.  Nice lady, bad professor, super boring class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Russell is a nice person, would not recommend taking her intro class though. She is slightly unorganized and we do a lot of pointless activities. However, it's not a completely terrible class. I will most likely receive an A and did not do a lot for the class. If you don't have many options, I'd take her.

This professor seemed nice, helpful and organized in the beginning of the semester. However, she ended up changing the whole curriculum midway through because she couldn't keep up with grading. She lost some students assignments and just gave out random grades after doing so. There is 1 mc test and 4 take home tests that she grades harshly on.

blech. changed syllabus 3 times before the 2nd test. scatterbrained. not prepared for class. lectures are laid back, tests are specific/hard. she didn't even put the correct answers in online so everyone got answers wrong then she was snarky about chaging them. research paper. dont take if you dont want to do. she stinks. lots of work!

Mixed feelings about this teacher. Nice person, hard to get office time for questions. Lectures mostly power point and goes so quickly that it's hard to take good notes. READ chapters and memorize definitions - some stuff comes back up in tests for later chapters. Final was online/open book. DON'T MISS CLASS - she passes around attendance sheet

Class is only difficult if you miss lectures or don't do the reading. It's expected that you not only know definitions, but be able to apply them in critical thinking. I got an A in this class while most were close to failing, but if you're willing to work for your grade she's an amazing professor.

tests are online, and she gave us two attempts on some of them. take notes in class, powerpoints a little hard to follow..mainly notes from lecture. shes really not that bad, you actually have to go to class, but she makes it somewhat interesting

This was the worst class I have ever taken! I have a 3.7 GPA, never made below a B, and never had to withdraw from a class...until this class. Teacher makes no time for you except after class but its hard to see her when you have a class right after. Test questions are very tricky and she does not teach the material you need to know for the test.
Annoying! Notes posted online. Tricky tests, so study the book. Only 4 tests. NO other assignments. Does NOT care about student success. Very bad professor!!

This was a really good class, and very interesting.Tests are worded a little tricky to make you think and make sure you paid attention. If you don't go, you will NOT pass. I received a "B" and I know that is the grade I earned. If I had studied harder, could have been an "A".

She is very easy, you just need to study her notes. She will post them on GAView. Tests might be tricky because she puts very few questions, but her tests will be based on what she anticipated they would be.

Class is a bore, notes are posted online, tests are hard for the lack of material taught, she is nice but doesn't seem to care that people can work very hard and still get a B because of her teaching and testing style.  She is usually late/rude/busy if you try to meet up with her or e-mail her... Do NOT need the book!

So annoying. Notes are posted VERBATIM online so the class is pretty pointless. Wording on tests are tricky, so you still have to study. Only 4 tests the whole class & she refuses to curve or give other assignments. Does NOT care about student success. Took this class to easily fulfill the requirement, and it will be the only B I get all semester.

She is probably the worst professor that I have ever had in my 4 years. I was afraid to take Dr. Smith for Human origins, so I chose to take Russell instead. Big mistake. I learned nothing. I suggest not registering for any of her classes. I received an A in the class. But if you are an Anth major, take Dr. Smith so u actually learn something.

Her notes are posted online. Her tests arent that hard if u really study her notes. However, class is very boring. Only 3 tests and thats the grade in the class, so if youre a bad test taker, then dont take her.
